ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What is that in your right hand, Musa?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: What is that in your right band, O Moses?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And what is in your right hand, O Moses?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Lord asked, "Moses, what is in your right hand?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And what is this in your right hand, O Moosa?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And what is that in your right hand, O Musa"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And what is this in your right hand, O Musa!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What is that, Moses, thou hast in thy right hand?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And what is that in thy right hand, O Moses?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: What do you have in your right hand, Moses?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And what is that in thy right hand, O Musa!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Moses, what is that in your right hand?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And what is that in the right hand, O Moses?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And what is that in your right hand, O Musa (Moses)?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What is that in your right hand, Moses'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And what is that in your right-hand, O Moses?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:17] And what is that, that happens to be, in your right hand, O Moses?’ (the interrogative is meant as an affirmative, [but it is expressed as an interrogative] in order that the miracle [to be manifested] in it be [shown as] consequent upon it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?
